alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 12:59AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Kennebec, southeastern Androscoggin, central Lincoln, east central Cumberland and Sagadahoc Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 1258 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Topsham to Bristol. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brunswick, Bath, Gardiner, Damariscotta, Topsham, Wiscasset, Freeport, Litchfield, Bristol, Woolwich, Lisbon, Durham, Boothbay, Bowdoin, Bowdoinham, Jefferson, Dresden, Edgecomb, Alna, and Arowsic. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 27 and 50. Interstate 95 between mile markers 97 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Kennebec; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc
